net.dean.jraw.http.oauth

Class StandardOAuthorizationFlow

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.dean.jraw.http.oauth.OAuthorizationFlow
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    NetworkAccessible<RedditResponse,RedditClient>, OAuthSpec

    public class StandardOAuthorizationFlow
extends java.lang.Object
implements OAuthSpec, NetworkAccessible<RedditResponse,RedditClient>
    This class assists users of this library in authenticating users for the app types of 'installed' or 'web'. A typical use of this class is as follows:

    1. Obtain an authorization URL using getAuthorizationUrl(String, String, boolean, String, String...).
    2. Point the user's browser to that URL and record the URL that the browser redirects to. This will be your app's redirect URI with a few arguments in the query.
    3. Give this data as well as an instance of Credentials to onAuthorize(String, String, Credentials). This method will parse the query arguments and report any errors. Once the request's integrity has been verified, a request to obtain the OAuth access code will be made.

      • getAuthorizationUrl

        public java.lang.String getAuthorizationUrl(java.lang.String clientId,
                                   java.lang.String redirectUri,
                                   boolean permanent,
                                   java.lang.String scope,
                                   java.lang.String... otherScopes)
        Description copied from interface: OAuthSpec
        Gets the URL used to authorize a user using OAuth2 'installed' or 'web' type app.
        Specified by:
        getAuthorizationUrl in interface OAuthSpec
        Parameters:
        clientId - The app's client ID
        redirectUri - The app's redirect URI. Must match exactly as in the app settings.
        permanent - Whether or not the token can be used more than one time
        Returns:
        The URL clients are sent to in order to authorize themselves

      • onAuthorize

        public AuthData onAuthorize(java.lang.String finalUrl,
                   java.lang.String redirectUri,
                   Credentials creds)
                     throws NetworkException,
                            OAuthException,
                            java.lang.IllegalStateException,
                            java.net.MalformedURLException
        Description copied from interface: OAuthSpec
        Parses the query arguments passed to this URI. If no error is present and the 'state' code matches the one most recently generated, then an access token is requested.
        Specified by:
        onAuthorize in interface OAuthSpec
        Parameters:
        finalUrl - The URL that the HTTP client redirected to after the user chose either to authorize or not authorize the application. This will be the app's redirect URI with the addition of a few query parameters.
        redirectUri - The app's redirect URI. Must match exactly as in the app settings.
        creds - The credentials to retrieve the access token with. Only the client ID and client secret will be used.
        Throws:
        NetworkException - If the request was not successful
        OAuthException - If there was a problem with any of the parameters given
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - If the state last generated with OAuthSpec.getAuthorizationUrl(String, String, boolean, String, String...) did not match the value of the 'state' query parameter.
        java.net.MalformedURLException - If finalUrl is not a valid URL

        Gets the HttpClient that allows this class to send HTTP requests
